parts.skip_text: Part 1 only applies to states with a S-CHIP program. Skip to Part 2.

questions.text: Does your program charge an enrollment fee?
How much is your enrollment fee?
Does your program charge a premium fee?

questions.skip_text: This question doesn’t apply to your state since you answered NO to Question 2.
questions.text: Are your premium fees tiered by Federal Poverty Level (FPL)?

questions.skip_text: This question doesn’t apply to your state since you answered NO to Question 2.
questions.text: Indicate the premium fee ranges and corresponding FPL ranges.
How much is your premium fee?
Is the maxiumum premium fee a family would be charged each year tiered by FPL?

questions.skip_text: This question doesn’t apply to your state since you answered NO to Question 2.
questions.text: Indicate the premium fee ranges and corresponding FPL ranges.
questions.answer_header: Max family premium fees tiered by FPL

questions.text: What's the maximum premium fee a family would be charged each year?
Do your premium fees differ for different CHIP populations beyond FPL (for example, by age)? If so, briefly explain the fee structure breakdown.
Which delivery system(s) do you use?
questions.hint: Select all that apply.

questions.text: Which delivery system(s) are available to which CHIP populations? Indicate whether eligibility status, income level, age range, or other criteria determine which delivery system a population receives.

parts.skip_text: Part 2 only applies to states with a M-CHIP program. Skip to Part 3.

questions.text: Does your program charge an enrollment fee?
How much is your enrollment fee?
Does your program charge a premium fee?

questions.skip_text: This question doesn’t apply to your state since you answered NO to Question 2.
questions.text: Are your premium fees tiered by Federal Poverty Level (FPL)?

questions.skip_text: This question doesn’t apply to your state since you answered NO to Question 2.
questions.text: Indicate the premium fee ranges and corresponding FPL ranges
How much is your premium fee?
Is the maxiumum premium fee a family would be charged each year tiered by FPL?

questions.skip_text: This question doesn’t apply to your state since you answered NO to Question 2.
questions.text: Indicate the premium fee ranges and corresponding FPL ranges.
questions.answer_header: Max family premium fees tiered by FPL

questions.text: What's the maximum premium fee a family would be charged each year?
Do your premium fees differ for different CHIP populations beyond FPL (for example, by age)? If so, briefly explain the fee structure breakdown.
Which delivery system(s) do you use?
questions.hint: Select all that apply.

questions.text: Which delivery system(s) are available to which CHIP populations? Indicate whether eligibility status, income level, age range, or other criteria determine which delivery system a population receives.

parts.header: Changes in S-CHIP Programs and Policies
parts.skip_text: Part 3 only applies to states with a S-CHIP program. Skip to Part 4.
parts.text: Indicate any changes you’ve made to your S-CHIP programs/policies in the past federal fiscal year. All changes require a State Plan Amendment (SPA).

questions.text: Have you made any changes to the eligibility determination process?
Have you made any changes to the eligibility redetermination process?
Have you made any changes to the eligibility levels or target populations?
questions.hint: For example: increasing the FPL or income levels, or other eligibility criteria.

questions.text: Have you made any changes to the benefits available to enrolees?
questions.hint: For example: adding or removing different types of coverage.

questions.text: Have you made any changes to the single streamlined application?
Have you made any changes to your outreach efforts?
Have you made any changes to the delivery system(s)?
questions.hint: For example: transitioning from Fee for Service to Managed Care for different CHIP populations.

questions.text: Have you made any changes to your cost sharing requirements?
questions.hint: For example: changing amounts, populations, or the collection process.

questions.text: Have you made any changes to the crowd-out policies?
questions.hint: For example: changing substitutions or the waiting periods.

questions.text: Have you made any changes to an enrollment freeze and/or enrollment cap?
Have you made any changes to the enrollment process for health plan selection?
Have you made any changes to the protections for applicants and enrollees?
questions.hint: For example: changing from the Medicaid Fair Hearing Process to state law.

questions.text: Have you made any changes to premium assistance?
questions.hint: For example: adding premium assistance or changing the population that receives premium assistance.

questions.text: Have you made any changes to the methods and procedures for preventing, investigating, or referring fraud or abuse cases?
Have you made any changes to your prenatal care eligibility?
questions.hint: For example: expanding eligibility to pregnant enrollees.

questions.text: Have you made any changes to your Pregnant Woman State Plan expansion?
questions.hint: For example: extending coverage to pregnant enrollees.

questions.text: Have you made any changes to eligibility for “lawfully residing pregnant women”?
Have you made any changes to eligibility for “lawfully residing children”?
Have you made any changes to any other program areas?
Anything else you'd like to add that wasn't already covered?

questions.conditional: Any 2020-01-03 question has a yes answer
questions.comment: Display bulleted list of all 2020-01-03 questions with yes answers
questions.text: Do you plan to submit a SPA to reflect changes to your programs or policies if you haven’t done so already?
